entry.title: Reland [clang] Disable autoupgrading debug info in ThinLTO builds
entry.content:
ThinLTO reads bitcode many times and attempts to upgrade the debug info every time. This is expensive since it calls the verifier. We don't need this given all LLVM bitcode producers are from the same version of LLVM.



For just the build step that runs ThinLTO and links official Chrome, measured 34T -> 32T instructions via perf stat.



Reland disables adding flag for ChromeOS since that toolchain is too old to have this flag.



Bug: 972449

Change-Id: I44552dd6c9dc71683c002d0c885e78b2a4341659

entry.title: Include client-drawn window decorations in aspect ratio.
entry.content:
Widget::SetAspectRatio() should set the aspect ratio of the content

area only, excluding the title bar and other decorations. To do so,

it assumes that the underlying platform window system ignores its

own title bar and other decorations when enforcing the aspect ratio.



Unfortunately, this doesn't work in those cases where chrome draws

the decorations in the non-client area; the underlying window manager

has no idea that these should be excluded, and the aspect ratio

of the Widget's contents is now wrong. This is visible in Picture

in Picture windows, which have a (chrome-drawn) title bar, and which

support aspect ratio lock.



This CL allows a WidgetDelegate to specify an additional number of

screen pixels to exclude from the aspect ratio calculation to take

into account any chrome-drawn decorations.



This CL includes the plumbing for the excluded margin, and an

implementation for Windows. Other implementations will follow in

separate CLs.



Change-Id: I150a8c806d42a9a60b6710fe300671b6afe9ac8c

Bug: 1407629

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4336172

entry.title: Adjust the shard numbers for Android 12, 12L, and 13 builders.
entry.content:
In details:

* android_browsertests: 2 -> 4

* content_browsertests: 25 -> 40



It appears the StartInstrumentation in these gtest suites has a timeout

threshold at ~19mins. And emulators hit this threshold quite often with

the original shard number and then could not recover from it, thus leave

a lot of tests in NORUN state.



Bump the shard so that runtime of each shard would be around 15mins and

reduce the chance to hit the timeout threshold.



Hopefully this would reduce the infra flakiness.



Bug: 1431581

Change-Id: I1bcf21464538a00ac6e87a786d8bcc05d1f61e17

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4471191

entry.title: Use GetFrameHostForNavigation() when picking error page RFH
entry.content:
When picking an RFH when committing an error page, in some cases it's

required to commit in the same process, e.g. for renderer-initiated

navigations that got blocked. Currently, the code immediately choose

to commit in the current RFH, which won't work with RenderDocument,

where cross-document navigations should change RenderFrameHosts.



This CL fixes the problem by making all cases of RFH picking for

error page navigations to call GetFrameHostForNavigation(), which

will work with RenderDocument, and updates that function to handle

the requirement for some error page navigations to commit in the

current process.



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Side aligned toasts and toast/popup/secondary bubble Fixes
entry.content:
The changes related to the toast position are guarded under a flag.

To test this change, run with `--enable-features=SideAlignedToasts`.



Move toasts default location to the side, at the same place where

notification popups usually show up. Toasts now have a higher z-index by

being placed in the `DragImageAndTooltipContainer`, so they will show in

front of tray bubbles and notification popups.



ToastOverlay now observes UnifiedSystemTray, so side aligned toasts

baseline will be shifted up whenever a slider bubble is shown.



Also updated (these are general fixes, not under the flag):

- Fixed a toast leading icon padding issue in RTL

- Fixed notification popup position in RTL with right shelf

- Remove `show_on_lock_screen` parameter in ToastOverlay since

ToastManager already handles the lock screen case. (toasts are queued

whenever the session is locked and `show_on_lock_screen` is false)

- Fix spacing between secondary bubbles (e.g. Sliders) and popups

- Rename `SetTrayBubbleHeight` to `NotifySecondaryBubbleHeight` in

unified_system_tray and in ash_message_popup_collection to

`SetBaselineOffset`



screenshots: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3tPAwHGhTeKSmr2



go/side-aligned-toasts

entry.title: Allow web attribution to be independently configurable in OS-Support
entry.content:
https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/758



Web attribution is explicitly disabled for WebView. This CL extends

the OS support enum to allow web attribution to be independently

configurable, and the Attribution-Reporting-Support header will

indicate the support level accordingly.



If neither web nor os-level attribution is enabled, background

attributionsrc requests will not be made, and

the Attribuiton-Reporting-Eligible header will not be set on requests.

Note that this applies even when kAttributionReportingCrossAppWeb

feature is disabled to avoid bandwidth waste.



A virtual function is added to ContentBrowserClient to allow WebView

to disable web attribution. A follow-up CL will enable OS support and

disable web support on WebView.



Note that we cannot add web tests for the NoWebOrOsSupport DevTools

issue type as there is no way to override the OS support value there.



Side note: when both web and OS are supported, the header is updated

to "os, web" to align with the explainer.



Bug: 1432278

entry.title: [HTTPS-Upgrades] Skip upgrades for non-unique hostnames
entry.content:
Previously, HTTPS upgrading skipped over requests for local IPs, since

it's not possible to get a publicly-trusted cert for them.



This CL expands that logic to all non-unique hostnames, since the same

logic applies.



Technically, it's possible for HTTPS to work on any of these hosts if

you have a locally-installed root cert, but the odds of success are low

and this keeps metrics more consistent across non-unique hosts. Note,

however, that recording the non-unique host enum still means something

different depending on whether HFM is enabled or not.

entry.title: Revert "[a11y] SetSize/PosInSet computed incorrectly for nested `TreeItems`"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 199d044ccb1a01f267f38e30ac357e3bf890e21a.



Reason for revert: Speculative revert for ReadAnythingAppTest failures

crbug.com/1439680

Example: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/39804/overview



Original change's description:

> [a11y] SetSize/PosInSet computed incorrectly for nested `TreeItems`

>

> This CL fixes a bug where the `SetSize` and `PosInSet` attributes are

> computed incorrectly for nodes with role `kTreeItem` that are nested

> within other `kTreeItem` nodes.

>

> We do this by internally now consider a node with role `kTreeItem` that

> is in a ordered set with role `kTreeItem` as matching, which we used to

> not do before.

>

> Previously, for a node with role `kTreeItem` to be considered

> to be matching it's ordered set's role, the set's role

> had to be `kTree`.

>

> Since `kTreeItem` nodes could have nested `kTreeItem` nodes,

> this behavior was incorrect.

>

> This CL also adds a test for when a `kTreeItem`'s parent is a

> `kGroup` element, which we were not testing for before.

>

> https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/treeitem_role

>

> Change-Id: I65a82cd0a9da4288870ca2f983436e98c45db463

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4450328

> Commit-Queue: Javier Contreras

> Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

> Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1134773}

entry.title: [Extensions] Add action to toggle side panel on icon click
entry.content:
This is a follow up from crrev.com/c/4400076 which added the API methods

and preference. This adds the implementation where clicking the

extension's icon when:

- the pref is enabled

- there is a side panel entry for the extension for the current tab

(contextual or global)



will:

- show the extension's side panel entry (contextual > global) if it

is not shown

- close the side panel if it is shown



Bug: 1408198

entry.title: [MFVEA] Fix bug with VP9 HW encoder reporting QP=0.
entry.content:
QP=0 was always reported because the QP value from

`output_data_buffer.pSample->GetUINT64` returned 0 (despite returning

success). Because we unconditionally plumbed this value down to WebRTC,

WebRTC did not parse the QP from the bitstream.



The fix is to not read the QP in the case of VP9, which fixes the issue

because the QP in the bitstream is correct and gets parsed by WebRTC

when we don't set any QP here.



The fix was confirmed by going to [1], pressing Start, and confirming

non-zero QP values in chrome://webrtc-internals/. The QP reported is the

same as in the bitstream (confirmed via bitstream dumping and going to

[2]), which falls into the default 0-255 range expected by

QualityScaler[3].



[1] https://orphis.github.io/webrtc-sandbox/simulcast-playground.html?resolution=HD&captureFramerate=30&codec=VP9&contentHint=&encodings.0.rid=&encodings.0.active=true&encodings.0.priority=low&encodings.0.maxBitrate=&encodings.0.scaleResolutionDownBy=&encodings.0.maxFramerate=&encodings.0.scalabilityMode=L1T1°radationPreference=&splitLayer=split

[2] https://ssilkin.github.io/bsparser/

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/webrtc/rtc_base/experiments/quality_scaling_experiment.cc;l=29;drc=a61b95c63b0b75c1cfe872d9c8cdf927c226046e



Bug: 1434633

Change-Id: I12833116a38edd51cd1166d01e2a474036a2a89e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4466212

entry.title: [Chromecast] Make Observable an interface.
entry.content:
This was always the intent, but Observable was forced to be an

abstract class because of some bugs in desugaring that were fixed

circa 2019 or 2020.



This slightly optimizes Observables created through the make()

function, as now there doesn't need to be a wrapper class adapting

the Function implementation to Observable, since now the lambda

can directly implement Observable.



This also gets rid of the Subscription class, which was just

supposed to be an alias for Scope, but since Java doesn't have

true aliases it imposes a small runtime cost to adapt Scopes

returned by Observers into Subscriptions. Documentation still

refers to the return values of `subscribe()` as "subscriptions"

but the type is now just Scope.



Bug: None

Test: cast_base_junit_tests, cast_shell_junit_tests

Change-Id: Ibb57b4f21591422a98cb995a2354a432062033dc

entry.title: float: Fix some issues with the virtual keyboard
entry.content:
The virtual keyboard doesn't trigger a work area change but affects the

work area returned by `WorkAreaInsets`. In tablet mode, this can leave

the floated window in a strange location when showing the VK, dragging

the window and releasing, and then hiding the VK.



This CL addresses that by using the work area calculations from the

screen util, which does not factor in the VK. This is the same

function used by snap and maximize state, which do not change bounds

when the VK is brought up.



Test: manual

Change-Id: I29cb37794151687991fd26093febe4ff8d209988

entry.title: Fenced frames: Make eventData optional.
entry.content:
Updated FenceEvent's IDL to make eventData field optional.

1. No eventData: beacon is sent with an empty string for the eventData

field.

window.fence.reportEvent({

eventType: 'click',

destination: ['buyer']

});



2. Has eventData: beacon is sent with the given string for the

eventData field.

window.fence.reportEvent({

eventType: 'click',

eventData: 'this is a click',

destination: ['buyer']

});



Pull request for updating the explainer:

https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/541

entry.title: chromeOS: Split existing memory pressure experiment in 2.
entry.content:
This CL is not intended to have any immediate effect as it splits a

disabled-by-default experiment into 2 disabled-by-default experiments.



We want to change the behavior of the existing

ChromeOSMemoryPressureSignal experiment to have different behavior for

ARC-enabled and ARC-disabled devices. This CL splits the experiment in 2

and updates the fieldtrial_testing_config.



This CL uses arc::IsArcAvailable as a proxy for whether arc is enabled.

This is safe to rely on in early lifecycle since the function only

relies on some command line flag checks. This means that some users who

are not actually using ARC will end up in the arc-enabled experiment.

This is expected and appropriate since the arc-enabled experiment is

safer and less aggressive than the arc-disabled experiment.



Change-Id: I7ce06e3b66b332a7aebf1a150b51704715b651d1

entry.title: Revert "[Performance Controls] Introduce discard time pref"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fbb6598dc720a79b68452316fed98b6461b0da97.



Reason for revert:

CL is causing crashes (https://crbug.com/1436044) and need time to put the fix out. Reverting so that branch cut is not blocked.



Original change's description:

> [Performance Controls] Introduce discard time pref

>

> Creates a pref to control the discard time in minutes for memory saver.

> The UI will be implemented at a later date, so to control the pref this

> CL also introduces a command line switch that the UPTM reads to set the

> default value of the pref. Once the multistate memory saver is rolled

> out, the user will be able to control the pref from the settings page,

entry.title: [Phone Hub][Eche] Use flag guards for PlaceholderView to prevent crashes
entry.content:
When the kEcheNetworkConnectionState flag is off, it was possible to

reach the PLACEHOLDER_VIEW UI State if there were no apps in the

recent apps metadata list. Doing so would trigger a crash because there

were no flag guards and the error_button_ and loading_view_ were being

used despite not being instantiated unless the network connection state

flag was enabled.



Test: Reproduced the crash by having the kEcheNetworkConnectionState

flag off and hard-coding the UI State to always be the placeholder view.

Then verified that with this fix, the crash no longer happens when the

flag is off and the placeholder view shows.



Fixed: b/279468293

Change-Id: I82225123f4ff0ea677153aa50943aaf8997ff761

entry.content:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/google/snappy.git/+log/65dc7b383985..c9f9edf6d75b



$ git log 65dc7b383..c9f9edf6d --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

2023-04-14 rjogrady Fixes for Windows bazel build.

2023-04-13 rjogrady Add initial bazel build support for snappy.

2023-04-12 rjogrady Upgrade googletest to v1.13.0 release.

2023-04-13 rjogrady Disable Wimplicit-int-float-conversion warning in googletest

2023-04-11 rjogrady Upgrade benchmark library to v1.7.1 release.

2023-04-11 rjogrady Disable -Wsign-compare warning.

2023-04-10 rjogrady Define missing SNAPPY_PREFETCH macros.

2023-03-21 tokarip Add prefetch to zippy compress

2023-03-16 no-reply Explicitly #include in snappy-internal.h

2023-03-16 no-reply Optimize check for uncommon decompression for ARM, saving two instructions and three cycles.

2023-03-08 costan Tag open source release 1.1.10.

2023-01-23 no-reply The output buffer in DecompressBranchless is never read from and the source buffers are never written. This allows us to defer any writes to the output buffer for an arbitrary amount of time as long as the writes all occur in the proper order. When a MemCopy64 would have normally occurred we save away the source address and length. Once we reach the location of the next write to the output buffer first perform the deferred copy. This gives time for the source address calculation and length to finish before the deferred copy.

2022-11-22 no-reply Allow some buffer overwrite on literal emitting

2022-11-18 tokarip Add prefetch to zippy decompess,

2022-11-09 no-reply Add "cc" clobbers to inline asm that modifies flags.

2022-11-03 no-reply Improve the speed of hashing in zippy compression.

2022-10-11 no-reply Modify MemCopy64 to use AVX 32 byte copies instead of SSE2 16 byte copies on capable x86 platforms. This gives an average speedup of 6.87% on Milan and 1.90% on Skylake.

2022-10-08 qrczak Fix the remaining occurrence of non-const `std::string::data()`.

2022-10-08 mpcallanan Fix compilation errors under C++11.

2022-10-05 qrczak Fix warnings due to use of `__attribute__(always_inline)` without `inline`.

2022-09-26 mpcallanan Add `snappy::CompressFromIOVec`.

2022-06-09 qrczak Move the comment about non-overlap requirement from the implementation to the contract of `MemCopy64()`, and clarify that it applies to `size`, not to 64.

2022-06-09 no-reply Optimize zippy MemCpy / MemMove during decompression

2022-04-27 no-reply Optimize Zippy compression for ARM by 5-10% by choosing csel instructions

2022-01-24 no-reply Fix compilation for older GCC and Clang versions.

2022-01-17 david.green Change LittleEndian loads/stores to use memcpy

2022-01-12 costan Update contributing guidelines.

2021-11-30 antoine Fix UBSan error (ptr + offset overflow)

entry.title: Fix a popover=hint related crash
entry.content:
The old code was erroneously using a for loop through the popover

stack, but that doesn't work for two reasons:

1. Popovers should close from the back to the front.

2. The popover stack could change while the loop runs.



This adds a test also.

entry.title: Refactor ProcessMetricsDecorator before adding CPU measurements
entry.content:
* Moves common code that splits memory measurements between frames and

workers to a helper function that can be reused for different types

of memory, and will be used for CPU measurements.

* Adds NodeDataDescribers to display the current measurement state on

the system node, and metrics estimates on frame and worker nodes.

* Move the unit test to the same directory as the implementation.

* Removes PageNodeImpl::usage_estimate_time() and

PageNodeImpl::private_footprint_kb_estimate() which seem related to

ProcessMetricsDecorator but are actually unused.

* Adds a non-renderer process to the unit test.



R=pmonette

entry.title: Sql: Add Statement helpers to store String16's as Blobs
entry.content:
The new Shared Storage API (https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage)

needs to be able to preserve potentially invalid UTF-16 strings that

API users store in the database, so that when they are retrieved, the

same strings are returned.



Currently, `sql::Statement::BindString16()` uses `base::UTF16ToUTF8()`

as it binds vales to statements, since the databases are encoded in

UTF-8. But `base::UTF16ToUTF8()` replaces invalid UTF-16 characters with the replacement character, according to the Unicode standard.



In this CL, we add helpers to `sql::Statement` to facilitate binding

a `std::u16string` as a `BLOB`, as well as retrieving a `BLOB` as a

`std::u16string`.



In https://crrev.com/c/4463360, we will migrate `SharedStorageDatabase` to use these new helpers. This approach to preserving potentially invalid UTF-16 strings replaces the initial approach planned in https://crrev.com/c/4413437, now abandoned.



Bug: 1430513

Change-Id: I0709e62103bfc3069053b7ee2438de8b221bf718

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4462153

entry.title: shortcuts: In search, hide accelerators that are disabled by unavailable keys, and automatically refresh results on change
entry.content:
This CL does two things:

1) it hides the accelerators in search results if their state is

kDisabledByUnavailableKeys, which aligns it with the change in

https://crrev.com/c/4363002. Now, the shortcuts are 100% in sync

between the main app and the search results.

2) adds a listener of SearchResultsAvailability to SearchBoxElement,

so that when the availability of the search results change (e.g. if

a keyboard is plugged in), the search results automatically update

so they can't become "stale" or out of date.



Test: browser_tests gtest_filter=ShortcutCustomizationAppSearch*

entry.content:
Expose the Windows-specific GetPaperPrintableArea() call from the Print

Backend service.



Add a browser test for getting GetPaperPrintableArea() from a service.

In addition to testing the new GetPaperPrintableArea() call, it also

illustrates how out-of-process handling for FetchCapabilities() is

providing valid printable areas for more than just the default paper

size. This behavior has been found to be slow on Windows for some

printer drivers, and will need to be changed.

entry.title: Adding golden (pixel diff) tests for `QRCodeGeneratorService`.
entry.content:
A few quick notes about the desirability of the test:



* This provides end-to-end coverage of the code under

components/qr_code_generator (this layer has unit tests which don't

verify the QR pixels beyond checking that only the 2 least significant

bits may be non-zero) and under chrome/services/qrcode_generator

(there are no tests at this layer).



* The maintenance burden for the golden / pixel diff tests should be

reasonably small, because we expect the QR images to change rarely.

(If the "Rusty QR Code Generator" project is successful, then the

images would only change when rolling the 3rd-party Rust crate to

a new version.)



* Having coverage of image output will provide extra reassurance that

the planned refactoring of the public API (and corresponding changes

to how the data is moved across the components) will have no impact on

the final image of the QR code.



* Note that this CL removes a stale "QRCodeGeneratorBubbleBrowserTest"

from `testing/buildbot/filters/pixel_tests.filter` - the test has been

removed in https://crrev.com/c/4304718 + AFAIU the pixel tests in the

old test covered more than just the image of a QR code (and therefore

may have been more of a maintenance burden).



Bug: 1431991

Change-Id: I71778cc12aa3a371a98ae868e1f0db39f5024266

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4437412
